intro: Agardhia, commonly known as the sea lettuce, is a type of green algae that belongs to the family Ulvaceae. It is a multicellular organism that forms flat, sheet-like structures, often growing in shallow coastal waters. Agardhia thrives in marine environments and is commonly found attached to rocks or other substrates. The plant has a simple structure with no true roots, stems, or leaves, but it does have a thallus that can vary in shape and size. It plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
